content: crossing paths mitts crochet pattern by tara briggs @taralovescrochet crossing paths mitts - february 2021 1 basic information yarn worsted weight 4 about 110 yards i used hand dyed merino wool from daisy stitch co hook us size h 4 5mm check your yarn weight pattern was designed using hand dyed worsted yarn which tends to be lighter/thinner than other worsted yarns you will likely be able to meet gauge with a heavier dk weight yarn such as loops and threads joy dk or lion brand comfy cotton or a lighter worsted weight yarn such as lion brand heartland or caron simply soft fit one size fits most these stitches have a lot of stretch finished mitt measures approximately 6 25 long and 8 25 in circumference widest point to adjust size add or subtract starting chains in sets of 2 the starting chain needs to remain an even number gauge 2 = 7 5 st by 4 rounds in pattern abbreviations and symbols chain - chain skip - skip st - stitch slip_stitch - slip_stitch double_crochet - double_crochet 2dc - 2 double_crochet in same st increase decrease - double_crochet two together decrease fhdc - foundation half_double_crochet optional * * - repeat this section - stitch counts for that round crossing paths mitts - february 2021 2 notes -mitts are worked in joined unturned rounds do not turn at the end of the round -when working the crossed stitches always work in front of the st just made -stitch counts are given at the end of each round in -chain 2 at the beginning of a round does not count as a stitch -chains within a round do count as stitches -half_double_crochet in 3rd loop this loop is found on the back side of a half_double_crochet stitch behind the v shape on top working in this loop gives us a uniquely textured ribbing see diagram below for the location of this loop crossing paths mitts - february 2021 3 pattern left chain 28 loosely join with a slip_stitch to form a loop be careful not to twist the chain or fhdc 28 and join then skip to row 2 round 1 chain 2 half_double_crochet around slip_stitch into 1st st to join 28 round 2 chain 2 half_double_crochet in 3rd loop around slip_stitch into 1st st to join 28 rounds 3-6 repeat rounds 1 and 2 two more times for longer ribbing/more wrist coverage repeat rounds 1 and 2 until desired length just make sure you match this on your second mitt round 7 chain 2 double_crochet around slip_stitch into 1st st to join 28 round 8 chain 2 *skip 1 st double_crochet in next st double_crochet in skip st* around slip_stitch into 1st st to join 28 round 9 chain 2 2dc in 1st st 2dc in 2nd st double_crochet around slip_stitch into 1st st to join 30 round 10 chain 2 *skip 1 st double_crochet in next st double_crochet in skip st* around slip_stitch into 1st st to join
